disclaimer.paragraphOne: The names and information used in this technical publication of ACTO, and the way in which the data, maps, images and charts containing geographic information of the Member Countries are represented, do not constitute a judgment on any other Treaties or International Acts in force between the Parties, nor about any disagreements about limits or territorial rights that exist between the Parties, nor can this document be interpreted or invoked to claim acceptance or waiver, affirmation or modification, direct or indirect, express or tacit, and the positions and interpretations that in these matters held by each Party.
disclaimer.paragraphTwo: This study was prepared considering the hydrological limit of the Amazon Basin and for this reason, Suriname, which does not have an area of water contribution in the Amazon Basin, was not considered in the analyzes of the study in question, even though it is a Member Country of the ACTO. According to the Amazon Cooperation Treaty (ACT), the results generated by this study will be beneficial for all 8 Member Countries, even Suriname not being part of the basin.
disclaimer.paragraphThree: In the case of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, the data referring to Brazo Casiquiare and Rio Negro, which correspond to the Venezuelan Amazon, were considered.
disclaimer.paragraphFour: From the definition of the content, methodology and assumptions for the study, contact was established with each of the Member Countries. From this contact, water quality monitoring data was obtained for the period from 2000 to 2019, which were compiled and standardized.
